page.title: 15Breach Lane, Hailey.
page.content:
Breach Lane used to be a road from Ramsden to Hailey and was wide enough for wagons to pass but now there is so much spooky undergrowth that the road is overgrown and is now a footpath. Barbed wire hangs off fences and makes them fall down.
Anyone can use footpaths and some are now bridleways were horses go. Walking is difficult because of mud, brambles and trees which over hang the path. As you hack away through the plants you get itchy and stung by nettles and thistles which grow to 150cm. Rabbit holes cause problems for people riding because horses hooves easily slip down the holes. We found the prints of deer and pheasant prints in the mud.
